programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Santa Ana, California, where an inexpensive-looking locker could lead to a huge payout for one team.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee meets Marvel Comics creator Stan Lee to find out if a rare signed comic is the real thing.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a Gilded Age train, before a classic Nintendo race car game from the 1960s rolls its way into the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley and Les head off to a huge estate sale. Seth takes a custom Corvette go-kart for a spin and Karen eyes up a piece of 1970s movie memorabilia.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les gets invited to give a lecture at a local business school. Meanwhile, Ashley and Bobby J go to war over a collection of Nerf guns.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and his team restore a large cannonball safe dating from the 1920s.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick fixes up a 1930s fishing boat, and takes on the tricky task of repairing a 19th-century coffee grinder.

programme.title: Nightmare in Suburbia
programme.desc: The case of a young mother who vanished in Hertfordshire. Police initially suspected she had run off with a lover, but after recovering her body soon had a prime suspect in mind.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: When 13-year-old Mollie Pittman is attacked and murdered in her friend's Orlando home, investigators are left with absolutely no clues to the killer's identity.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers attend auctions in a small town where one of the teams acquires a strange wooden box that turns out to have unexpected value.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky is confronted with one of his biggest fears, and Victor gets more than he bargained for when he pursues a motorcycle.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les questions Ashley's management skills when two employees get into a fight on the shop floor. Meanwhile, Seth stumbles upon a potentially huge deal.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les hatches a secret plan to put his employees to the test, but how will Seth, Ashley and Karen react when they find out.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine a letter from Founding Father James Monroe and a promotional Playboy chair. Chum tries to reinvent himself in the image of Hugh Hefner.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey checks out a 1972 telegram that prevents Muhammad Ali from fighting in Alaska, and a first edition copy of Oscar Wilde's The Happy Prince arrives in store.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts open previously off-limits secret files in a bid to answer some of the most mysterious questions surrounding UFOs and extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.sub-title: Aliens and the Creation of Man
programme.desc: Can unexplained advances in human evolution be attributed to alien architects? Giorgio Tsoukalos joines forces with alien theorists to look at the evidence.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Brettly restores a 19th-century gun vending machine, while Rick and the team work on the meter from a 1950s taxi.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The guys restore a police phone box from New York, and Tyler brings a 1947 railway maintenance vehicle into the shop, but underestimates how much it will cost to repair.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a 1974 Triumph Convertible, a pair of whale spears come into the shop, and Chum relives his childhood with a pair of Popeye water pistols.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey comes face to face with a Ronald Reagan foam head, but it remains to be seen whether he will make an offer on the piece.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell fights off competition as he tries to secure a locker worth $27,000, and Dave bids for a unit with a stockpile of antiques.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave has his eye on an electronics locker, and Darrell uncovers a classic movie prop.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny Grumbles competes against her rivals to buy the locker of her dreams, while one of her fellow bidders demonstrates a darker side.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A stranger on a motorbike drives up the prices at an auction in DeSoto, where there are only four lockers up for grabs.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After layering a complex Damascus pattern in their signature blades, the remaining bladesmiths recreate a three-bladed African throwing knife called the Kpinga.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1957 Harley-Davidson Sportster roars into the shop, and Rick takes a look at a painting of Vietnamese Communist leader Ho Chi Minh.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick unrolls work by Shepard Fairey, the artist that produced the famous President Obama posters. Corey and Chumlee look for a deal on a Mork figurine.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: A countdown of the top 10 most interesting reported alien encounters.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts scrutinise prehistoric ruins, asking whether humans could have built such advanced structures alone, and examine the possibility of alien intervention.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When Ashley interferes with one of Karen's sales on the shop floor, a family feud breaks out. Meanwhile, a rock metal group drops by.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les finally lands a buyer for his special edition Lee Iacocca Mustang, but loses his cool when he learns Seth sent the hot rod out on consignment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry asks a member of rock band Aerosmith for a valuation, and Dave discovers an antique toy.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave comes to blows with his estranged brother over rock memorabilia, and Barry discovers a valuable piece of modern art.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick considers removing six Picasso etchings from an illustrated edition of Lysistrata, then he and Corey take an amphibious Jeep out on the water.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.sub-title: Lock Stock and Two Nickel Barrels
programme.desc: The pawn shop workers take a look at nickel-plated pistols, supposedly made by the most famous gun maker of the Victorian era.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A ghost appears on the Gettysburg battlefield, a sea monster surfaces in Ireland and fleets of UFOs are spotted over the skies of Philadelphia and The Hague.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Experts examine the concept of crop circles, investigating whether these odd patterns could be a message from another world or just an elaborate hoax.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell fights off competition as he tries to secure a locker worth $27,000, and Dave bids for a unit with a stockpile of antiques.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave has his eye on an electronics locker, and Darrell uncovers a classic movie prop.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Jeremy Hardy, Barry Cryer and Jeremy Clarkson for more interesting answers on subjects including Birmingham, Bhutan and baldness in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Rob Beckett, Ed Gamble, Sara Pascoe and John Robins join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the events of October 2016 through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Clive Anderson, Phill Jupitus and Rich Hall for more interesting answers on subjects including bombs, bats and bagpipes in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Jeremy Hardy, Barry Cryer and Jeremy Clarkson for more interesting answers on subjects including Birmingham, Bhutan and baldness in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: Flack
programme.desc: Robyn tries to distract the press from the fact that her client is being dropped by her record label by leaking a fake lesbian sex tape. Elsewhere, while trying to turn off the persistently ringing phone in her handbag, Robyn inadvertently tips out a cocaine bullet, much to the amusement of Tom (Marc Warren), the man sitting next to her at the Narcotics Anonymous meeting.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedians Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe, actor and writer Steve Pemberton and presenter Fern Britton continue the daily test of their skills. Hosted by Richard Osman.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Staffordshire Police officers encounter a man who fancies some late-night shopping in Stoke, smashing his way through a shop front with an axe.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are presented with a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity in Texas and also uncover a stash that includes a meteorite.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: T-Money heads to an auction in a Californian suburb and lands himself some fishing equipment.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: A new couple rub Brandon and Lori up the wrong way and bid on some knock-off Hollywood costumes.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys' road trip leads them to a very impressive car, and Mike takes a gamble by buying a Harley Knucklehead motorcycle.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Danielle discovers Mike and Frank have been concealing an expensive secret, and an elderly artist shows the guys a shrine to his ex-lovers.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The work taking place in one of Britain's leading police car workshops, as bespoke vehicles are built and repairs made to ones that have been out in the field. In the first episode, John Heussi finds himself in need of a new riot van, and stress-testing the old one helps him design a new one.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters square up to their Australian counterparts in an automotive version of the Ashes, with challenges including rallying, drifting and a double-decker car race. Jeremy Clarkson also test-drives the Ferrari 599 GTO, and Boris Becker gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: James is called to a drunk driver who, in his inebriated state, has crashed his car into a parked vehicle at high speed, but the story takes a twist when his girlfriend arrives.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: An electrical lineman asks Steve Darnell and his team to customise his trusty old 1970s Ford pickup.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of a Jaguar XJ and races against the rotation of the Earth. James May travels to America to drive a Nasa Space Exploration Vehicle and Richard Hammond tests two of the most famous supercars of the 1980s - the Porsche 959 and the Ferrari F40. John Prescott is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May put three supercars through their paces in Italy. Their weapons of choice are the 691bhp Lamborghini Aventador, McLaren's hi-tech MP4-12C, and a British brute in the form of the Noble M600. The journey begins at Nardo, a high-speed testing ground so vast it can be seen from space, and includes a nerve-racking drive in Rome before reaching its conclusion with a timed challenge against the Stig at the Imola circuit. The trio are also joined by The Voice mentor Will.i am, who takes the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the quiz show, making a meal of some M-themed food topics as Cariad Lloyd, Dermot O'Leary and Phill Jupitus compete alongside resident panellist Alan Davies. As usual, points are awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting, regardless of whether or not they are correct.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ellie Taylor, Steve Pemberton, Fern Britton and Josh Widdicombe test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Lorraine Kelly and Dara O Briain join David Mitchell's team while Barry Cryer and Sue Perkins are captained by Lee Mack, on the panel game where contestants try to fool their opponents into mistaking fact for fiction and vice versa. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents the comedy panel show, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests Alex Jones, Chris Tarrant, Alexander Armstrong and Mel Giedroyc to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Al Murray, Chris Addison and Tim Vine
programme.desc: Al Murray, the Pub Landlord, hosts the stand-up comedy show from London's Hammersmith Apollo, welcoming guests The Thick of It star Chris Addison and one-liner specialist Tim Vine.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Jonathan Ross, Maisie Adam, Sara Barron and Rob Beckett are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Bill Bailey and Jimmy Carr for more interesting answers on subjects including bears, bulbs and bamboo in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Anneka Rice, Sean Lock and Bill Bailey for more interesting answers on subjects including beavers, bulges and bacteria in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher objects to having a third cellmate foisted on him, especially as the newcomer seems to enjoy special privileges and the full backing of the wardens. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates are shocked to discover there is a thief in their midst, so Fletcher decides to stage a mock trial to bring the culprit to justice with the help of Slade's resident legal consultant Judge Rawley. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Maurice Denham.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The US Navy's fastest combat ships, which are capable of a turn of speed only possible due to a revolutionary water propulsion system and the chance discovery of a brand new alloy.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian begins the next leg of his trip in Kasama, northern Zambia. His first stop is the town of Mpika, where he meets college students training to be locomotive drivers. Next, in the capital Lusaka, he reveals how the first railways were built to access the country's rich mineral wealth, and watches craftsmen cutting emeralds and rubies - before being let loose on a pair of bejewelled cufflinks. Griff then reaches the spectacular Victoria Falls on his way to Zimbabwe's second-largest city, Bulawayo.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Tesla automotive manufacturing facility, where the world's strongest robots produce 2000 cars a week. Featuring a comparison with the world's first production line.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An eerie, empty country village which hides a sad secret, a mysterious tower battered by the elements and a disused railway deep beneath the streets of a city.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Allied offensive in the Pacific, where America's two-pronged attack led to heavy casualties on both sides, as the Japanese mounted a ferocious defence. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Drama-documentary revealing the most shocking and surprising murder cases in history. At the time of Jack the Ripper, London was home to some of the most terrible individuals the city has ever seen. One of the very worst was the elusive Borough Poisoner, George Chapman. Presenter Nicholas Day reveals how he was finally brought to justice.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Tesla automotive manufacturing facility, where the world's strongest robots produce 2000 cars a week. Featuring a comparison with the world's first production line.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: An investigation into a wreck in the Bristol Channel identified by divers as a First World War hospital ship, the sinking of which constituted a major war crime.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The case of Dr Crippen, who murdered his wife and buried her in the basement before fleeing to Canada.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Meeting the Welsh Highland Railway's oldest volunteer fireman, 80-year-old Cedric Lodge, who has worked on the railways for 60 years. In Devon, there is a look at the Autotrain.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An eerie, empty country village which hides a sad secret, a mysterious tower battered by the elements and a disused railway deep beneath the streets of a city.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Allied offensive in the Pacific, where America's two-pronged attack led to heavy casualties on both sides, as the Japanese mounted a ferocious defence. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Great Central Railway's Scott Manley takes a rainy busman's holiday working as a guard at Bury, while a team of volunteers in Wales try to keep the line clear of overgrown plants.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A floating bridge in Seattle, one of the longest such structures in the world, intended to connect the growing suburb of Bellevue with the high-tech downtown heart of the city. Plus, Albert Zwueste is on the Dutch Caribbean island of Curacao exploring one of the world's oldest surviving floating bridges, which helped inspire and inform the Seattle project.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher objects to having a third cellmate foisted on him, especially as the newcomer seems to enjoy special privileges and the full backing of the wardens. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates are shocked to discover there is a thief in their midst, so Fletcher decides to stage a mock trial to bring the culprit to justice with the help of Slade's resident legal consultant Judge Rawley. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Maurice Denham.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Great Central Railway's Scott Manley takes a rainy busman's holiday working as a guard at Bury, while a team of volunteers in Wales try to keep the line clear of overgrown plants.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A war begins between rival taxi firms, confronting the team with a series of coincidences to investigate, and Taggart's family problems are compounded when his daughter is implicated in a murder investigation. Glasgow-set detective drama, with Mark McManus, James MacPherson and Blythe Duff. Directed by series regular Alan Macmillan, who also worked on The Bill and Ballykissangel. The supporting cast includes Iain Anders, Robert Robertson, Stewart Preston, Harriet Buchan, Leigh Biagi, Andy McEwan and Peter O'Brien.

credits.director: who also worked on The Bill

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Marsham learns his wife has breast cancer and tries to make amends for neglecting her, shelving a planned move to Scotland and begging Robert and Eleanor to perform a life-saving operation. Medical drama, starring Jemma Redgrave and David Calder.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Following the Radford family's botched attempt to spring David from prison, Irene drives off with Gina at gunpoint and forces the inspector to let her colleagues know she means business. If they don't give up the chase, she won't hesitate to pull the trigger. Soon, Gina finds herself alone with her enemy, and as they begin to talk, the two of them realise they understand one another better than they could possibly have imagined. However, when Irene orders the shooting of Jack Gaunt, it becomes clear Gina is still in very real danger. Meanwhile, Honey has it out with Steve, disappointed that he had sex with Amber, and accusing him of being as bad as his brother. Indeed, Phil is having his fair share of problems as Sam discovers that his New Year's invitation followed hard on the heels of his dalliance with the prison liaison officer. Roberta Taylor, Lynda Bellingham, Lisa Maxwell and Scott Maslen star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor is flattered by the attentions of charming Dr Hunter, at least on first impressions, but soon changes her opinion when his housekeeper dies suddenly.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Butcher celebrates his forthcoming wedding to Stacey with a riotous stag party in France, but finds Continental hospitality losing its allure after a transport strike strands him on the wrong side of the Channel. While Steve Evans pulls out all the stops to get his friend to the church on time, Dr Sarah Eastwood faces an agonising romantic dilemma and Chris comes to a momentous decision.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Following the Radford family's botched attempt to spring David from prison, Irene drives off with Gina at gunpoint and forces the inspector to let her colleagues know she means business. If they don't give up the chase, she won't hesitate to pull the trigger. Soon, Gina finds herself alone with her enemy, and as they begin to talk, the two of them realise they understand one another better than they could possibly have imagined. However, when Irene orders the shooting of Jack Gaunt, it becomes clear Gina is still in very real danger. Meanwhile, Honey has it out with Steve, disappointed that he had sex with Amber, and accusing him of being as bad as his brother. Indeed, Phil is having his fair share of problems as Sam discovers that his New Year's invitation followed hard on the heels of his dalliance with the prison liaison officer. Roberta Taylor, Lynda Bellingham, Lisa Maxwell and Scott Maslen star.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: As the day of the wedding dawns, Chrissie and Owen wake up together. But while she is convinced this means he won't go through with marrying Diane, she is soon disabused of this notion when he dismisses the previous night as a drunken mistake. Tricia ends up becoming everybody's confidante, and Jodie is rushed to hospital after she collapses at Mickie's house. Connie discovers her condition is caused by a disastrous old operation, and ends up having to remove her lung. The tense situation is complicated further when it emerges Jodie and Will have a history together.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jack has a crisis of confidence when a patient arrives in the department and leaves Charlie to pick up the pieces. Meanwhile, a teenage girl samples drugs with an older man.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Staff shortages cause tension in CPU, with Ramani bearing the brunt as she struggles to cope with an increased workload - and when an outside source brings the matter to Adam's attention, the situation becomes hugely political, only serving to aggravate the already volatile relationship between Jack and Neil. By way of an immediate solution, Jack assigns Terry to help Ramani with the case of a man suspected of being a paedophile - but Ramani is worried about Terry's ability to deal with such a task given his own traumatic background. Meanwhile, the rest of the relief let their hair down at Lance's stag party - but when the guest of honour nips outside for a breath of fresh air, he is suddenly attacked from behind by a group who put a bag over his head and bundle him into the back of a van. It could just be a stag night prank - or it could be something more serious. Guest starring Annabelle Apsion and Colm O'Maonlai.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mandy tries to persuade Mark to let her stay in the squat. Ian's dishonesty catches up with him, while Arthur plays detective to track down his garden gnome.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Two birthdays in the Fowler family; Pete is the life and soul of Martin's party, but will an unwelcome guest ruin Michelle's?.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A window cleaner gets his arm trapped in a cradle mechanism at the top of a tower block, and Sicknote is sent over the edge to rescue him.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A romantic weekend in the country turns sour for Charlotte and Lovejoy when one of her friends takes a shine to him. Matters deteriorate further for the dodgy dealer when he learns Charlie is trying to evict his business. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane, Caroline Langrishe and Malcolm Tierney.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim experiences complications while conducting an investigation into the disappearance of a financier. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Lilo Lill turns up on the doorstep, Joey meets Roxy, Adrian buys something really stupid and Aveline is insulted by a photographer.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The staff try to stop Ted celebrating his birthday every two weeks in a bid to con gifts and free drinks out of gullible holiday-makers. Meanwhile, there may be trouble ahead when the runner-up in the Holiday Princess competition is spotted entering a staff chalet at night. Comedy, starring Paul Shane and Su Pollard.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: The announcement of Jean and Lionel's wedding date gives the neighbourhood women the perfect opportunity to go shopping for new outfits - until the bride-to-be is accused of shoplifting. Comedy, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lenny hears a voice from above, and decides he must wait patiently for more information, leaving the gang to make sure he is well-equipped to receive messages. Comedian Bobby Ball returns as the gullible pickle factory worker, with Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuth tries to help a road rage victim, but lands right in the middle of a family tragedy she may be unable to control. Hetty tries to fix the missing pieces of the puzzle into place and her client gets a very unexpected result.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Part one of two. After two pop singers are electrocuted while performing on a TV music show, Peregrine's impartiality is tested when an old boyfriend is named as the lead suspect in the case. Geraldine Hakewill stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad is ordered by its new boss to look into the unsolved murder of a barrister found bound and gagged in his car 25 years ago. The case was a rare failure for a former chief inspector, although his notes point to a very clear suspect. As they uncover the late advocate's unusual hobbies, they gradually learn exactly what happened. Anita Dobson, Jenny Agutter and Keith Barron guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: An informant is due to give evidence against his former boss, one of Glasgow's most powerful gang leaders - but police fail to get the witness to court. Drama, with Mark McManus, Blythe Duff and James MacPherson. Co-star Gray O'Brien makes one of six appearances in the series, years before playing Tony Gordon in Coronation Street. More recently he popped up in The Loch, and Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators. Director Richard Holthouse went on to helm several episodes of Midsomer Murders.

credits.director: Richard Holthouse went on to helm several episodes of Midsomer Murders

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: The funerals approach, and without the answers he needs and still more questions being thrown up from White House Farm, Stan's efforts remain fruitless. When all looks lost for Stan and Mick solving the case, a vital witness comes forward. Six-part drama based on the true story of the mass murder of a family in an Essex farmhouse in August 1985, providing a fresh insight into the tragic events. Starring Alfie Allen, Mark Addy and Andrew Frame.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The celebrated chef arrives in the Dordogne, famous for its traditional hearty cuisine, buried treasures and a love of all things duck. Exploring the region, James tastes three local specialities all cooked for him by the Auberge owner, British ex-pat Chris. After lunch, Chris hunts for another local icon, the black truffle, which he intends to use in his next recipe.

programme.title: Judge Rinder

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a family of five answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Rob, Sharon, Jayne and Dan pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Scottish Conservative and Unionist Party.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Laurel receives some shocking news, Luke gets himself a new job, and Vanessa stops Rhona from going too far.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Geoff leaves Yasmeen locked in a magic box, and Roy is perplexed when Beth says she caught Nina going through the factory bins. Tim tries to worm his way back in with Sally by playing the track from their first wedding dance through the letterbox.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Bradley is on the mend following his rodeo injury and determined to get back behind the wheel of the RV. As the pair continue on their journey, Barney is thrilled to be celebrating his birthday with a trip to the iconic Niagara Falls. Later, Bradley and Barney take the RV on a small cargo ferry as they head to Vermont. Here, the pair have a go at ice climbing, which proves treacherous for them and the crew, before a spot of dog sledding through the frozen wilderness and an inevitable race through the forests.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Eileen quizzes Brian and Cathy about Yasmeen's supposed drink problem, while Roy and Carla are worried to discover Nina moved out of her flat weeks ago. Sally looks over Tim's divorce papers and is then bemused to find a mock-up invitation for her own wedding.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: With the testimony of a vital witness confirming some of Stan and Mick's suspicions, Taff still remains unconvinced, but the police are now forced to question what they thought they knew previously, and pursue the case against Jeremy. Six-part drama based on the true story of the mass murder of a family in an Essex farmhouse in August 1985, providing a fresh insight into these tragic events. Starring Mark Addy, Alexa Davies, Freddie Fox and Tom Christian.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: In a bid to honour wounded veterans, Dan Bagwell attempts a near-impossible conversion, by making a 1970 Chevrolet Chevelle SS handicapped-accessible.

programme.title: Heli-Loggers
programme.desc: Gord Closson is forced to intervene when environmental problems caused by another logging company threaten to contaminate the water supply of a nearby town.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes behind the production of iron cookware, biodiesel and clothes hangers.

programme.title: How It's Made

programme.title: How Do They Do It?

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Robbie uncover a hidden stash of awesome motorcycle relics at a Colorado property littered with massive man-mobiles.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A combination of broken fishing pots and a damaged engine causes the Northwestern to fall a week behind schedule, and the captain comes up with a plan to improve his fortunes.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Inexperience and equipment problems cause conflict among the miners, while big swells and bad conditions leave some of the gold divers seasick.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: There are headaches on the horizon for Steve taking on the Tanami with a trailer load of trouble and it's a wild ride for Nigel Vagg hauling 900 feral goats through a heatwave.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China try to make a profit on their first electric project as they restore a 1985 Maserati Bi-Turbo that was converted to electric in the early 1990s.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: Noah has his hands full modifying a 1957 Chevy Bel Air. However, a mystery client that they've never met has high demands for turning a '69 Camaro into a luxury ride.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Robbie uncover a hidden stash of awesome motorcycle relics at a Colorado property littered with massive man-mobiles.

programme.title: Railroad Australia

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: First-time crewmen are tested by the harsh winter, and as conditions at sea deteriorate rapidly, the newest members of the Northwestern and the Cornelia Marie prove their worth.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Scott goes out dredging without crew, but hits a honey hole. Meanwhile, Zeke goes back to 'The Clark' and gets too close to a neighbour's lease.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Salvager Drew Pritchard explores a Napoleonic fort in Essex, and tours the medieval Lichfield Cathedral, where he checks out some unwanted objects.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Sludge and the Phantom battle against the elements, and an old river boat takes a bumpy road to repair. Meanwhile, Turbo has problems with weight, weather and wheel bearings.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a part-restored Camaro in California with its fair share of problems. Can he and Edd work their magic and make a profit on the project?.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A junkyard wizard has an Oktoberfest gem with Frank Fritz's name written all over it.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard searches the UK for valuable scrap items. He tries to make a profit on a collection of 19th-century balconet rails, finds himself bartering with a baronet at one of Scotland's grandest estates and is given a run for his money by a seasoned salvager.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for a motoring mission. They scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit the Cotswolds and Somerset, where finds include a set of milk churns and an old munitions shell.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How the biggest apartment block in the world was built, how the classic British boot is made, and how cooking pans are designed to be tough enough to last a lifetime.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how the sitar, a classic Indian instrument, is crafted, how beef biltong is made, and how large bulldozers are built.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: A local psychic claims to have had a vision of the fate of a nine-year-old boy abducted from a bus stop.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How professionals meticulously examine everyday items to establish evidence of guilt incriminating even the most meticulous of criminals.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: A look at the real-life murder cases inspired by those depicted in film and TV shows, such as CSI: Crime Scene Investigation.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 66-year-old Sharron Erickson, who was raped and murdered in the small Midwestern town of Colon, Nebraska in June 2003. James Marrs, who lived just 75 feet away, was later found guilty of the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: An 11-year-old girl's body is found washed up on a beach, prompting federal investigators to look into her uncle's background.

programme.title: Animal Cops
programme.desc: Inspectors make a shocking discovery when they find two tigers and 11 bears in a chicken shed.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Blacky the cat suffers cruel injuries, a blind dog is in dire straits, Pam the kid forms a maternal relationship with Liesl and Chris becomes a midwife.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman who is renewing her wedding vows brings her two sons with her to choose her dress, but struggles when they do not approve of her choice.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Pageant queen Anastagia wants to choose her own dress, but first she needs to battle her mother's influence. Lisa clashes with her mum over an ivory gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A customer brings her mother's Princess Diana-style 1980s wedding dress to the store to give the staff an idea what she wants, while another customer is planning a Twilight-themed wedding.

programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats Tigger the dog, who was hit by a car, Tim Faulkner makes a surprise discovery in one family's walls and a young boxer dog is struggling to walk.

programme.desc: The investigators respond to a report of a dead puppy in a yard, but when they get there they find the animal is still alive and race to save it.

programme.desc: Transforming items reclaimed from Woking Recycling Centre, including a tired leather sofa which Neil Wragg attempts to make into beautiful bags.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How computerisation has made fingerprint identification much more efficient, allowing the time-tested method to take place in a matter of minutes.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: When popular college student Martin Roberts went missing, only a cryptic note was left behind. Two years later, his relatives were intent on solving the mystery once and for all.

programme.title: Disappeared

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Injured army vet Shealynn is treated to a surprise when comedian Seth Meyers turns up, while model Ashley wants a slinky dress that also gets the approval of her father.

programme.desc: Britanny shops with her uncle, who insists her dress has lots of sparkle, while Nicole finds her father is eager to please.
